resource.chars:
Explanation of the Map & Sections, Plates
As the object of the Map is to represent the direction
of the Foliation & Cleavage the geological features
which have no reference to that subject have been
kept as little prominent as possible & only <s>those> as many colors
employed as were indispensable. The whole of the
foliated rocks are painted of one yellow color, which
thus includes Gneiss, Mica Schist, Chlorite Schist
Hornblende Schist & the gneissose Quartz rock.
The stratified Slates are colored purple. The brown
color includes the Old Red Sandstone, the stratified
Quartz Rock & the Limestones associated with
them. The more modern formations which cover
a very small space in the Highlands are omitted.
Granite, Syenite & the older Porphyries are colored
pink, & the more modern Trap-Rocks red. Thus
two colors, the yellow & purple represent the rocks
affected by the foliation & cleavage; the pink
includes all the plutonic rocks which have
broken through & disturbed the foliation & cleavage,
the brown & red represent the rocks which overlie
& conceal the rocks affected by those phenomena.
The <u>strike<\u> or direction of the foliation & cleavage
<s>throu<\s> across the surface is indicated by <s>the<\s> black
lines; when these <u>are double<\u> the foliation or cleavage
is vertical; a single
thicker line represents the
central axis of an arch of foliation. The dotted
